alert.note: Alert for Monroe Middle Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 10:50PM EDT by NWS Key West
info.description: ...Fast moving showers and thunderstorms will impact portions of Middle Keys in Monroe County through 1115 PM EDT... At 1049 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Seven Mile Bridge to near Long Key. Movement was northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marathon, East End Of Long Key Viaduct, Seven Mile Bridge, Long Key Viaduct, West End Of Channel 5 Bridge, East End Of Seven Mile Bridge, West End Of Long Key Viaduct, West End Of Seven Mile Bridge, Long Key and Boot Key. This includes US 1 between mile markers 42 and 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
